item.title: Cryogen Workflow
item.description:
The github deployment plot thickens

In order to deploy my Cryogen blog onto github.io, I had created two different repos
  • My Cryogen project
  • the github.io generated pages

After running 

lein ring server-headless
in the cryogen project I would manually copy the generated files from the /resources/public/ folder to the root of the github.io repo. I assumed I was missing something.

According to this page, this is basically it. Very meh.

Perhaps a Leiningen plugin is in order.
item.author: Eric Somdahl

item.title: Setup
item.description:
Hi There

This is my first post to what I hope will be a vaguely useful blog. If only for myself -- as a means of recording useful things I stumble across as I solve problems in either my work or my recreational software development.

I may also post about motorcycles. Or judo. I like to learn about those things as well.

I think my first task will be to do something to automate this posting workflow. I am currently learning Clojure and in an effort to eat some of my own dogfood I am using Cryogen to generate this site. Surely there is some way to get Leiningen to push this to Github for me...
item.author: Eric Somdahl
